A road to the city is opened by the Golden Gate (1164). In their meaning they were like the Golden Gate of Constantinople or the Golden Gates of Kiev,from which the road to the heart of the capital began - to the monasteries and the St. Sophia Cathedral. But the Golden Gate of Vladimir was not only the triumphal arch of the city. It was a battle fortress that could withstand the onslaught of the Tatar hordes.

Entertainment in the park is not limited only to attractions. Concerts, contests, meetings with interesting people are held constantly here. And always holidays are celebrated by special programs. There are exhibitions of children's drawings, gaming, theatrical, and sports competitions, performances of creative groups.

the court temple, built by Vsevolod the Big Nest in the prince\'s court and consecrated in honor of the Great Martyr Demetrius of Thessalonica. According to N. N. Voronin, it was built in 1194-1197. The cathedral is famous for its white stone carvings - its walls are decorated with about 600 reliefs depicting saints, mythical and real animals. Most of the reliefs were preserved in their original form.

Georgievskaya street recently became pedestrian with two new viewing platforms appeared at once. Georgievskaya street was landscaped by the day of the city of Vladimir in 2015 - the buildings were restored, the road was laid with paving stones, set benches, set up sculptures, and at the end of the street there was an observation deck with views of the Uspenskiy Cathedral.

The building of the City Duma was built in 1907 in the very center of the city on Cathedral Square with the money of Vladimir merchants. The City Duma is a 2-story building under a metal four-tiled roof. The central facade ends on two sides with two small tents. The facades are decorated with elements typical of Old Russian architecture. The building is decorated with a keel arch under the balcony at the level of the 2nd floor.

The work of the masters of glass and crystal is represented by products that can only cause admiration. From colored glass and crystal there are presented instruments for wine, water, honey, as well as vases, decorative dishes and other products.

One of the most beautiful places in Vladimir. The garden dates back to the 16th century. In Vladimir there was no patriarch\'s residence, but the cherry orchard was specially planted, where the capital\'s clergy came to rest. Patriarchal gardens are 3 hectares of land planted with dozens of varieties of fruit trees and shrubs, berries, wild plants and herbs. The garden descends to the Klyazma steps, it is multi-level, presented in the traditions of French park architecture.

The square located next to the city\'s planetarium is very small in space. In the square there is a monument to Alexander Nevsky. The uniqueness of this place in a stunning form opening to the Klyazmen floodplain. The lawns with wood framing prevail.

From the observation platform in Pushkin Park one can see the architectural monuments of Vladimir and the magnificent panorama of Vladimir\'s expanses, in the distance one can see the Country Park. On July 28, 2007, in connection with the 850th anniversary of the transfer of the capital of Rus from Kiev to Vladimir on the observation platform a monument to the founder of the city, Prince Vladimir Krasnoe Solnyshko (Red Sun) and Saint Fedor, the baptizer of the Vladimir land.

One of the new sightseens - a small square near the church, called "Spasskiy Hill" was landscaped to the City Day of Vladimir in 2014. On the Spasskiy hill, guests are greeted by the "Oak tree".It is known that it is widespread in the forests of the region. From the observation platform of the Spasskiy Hill, one will see a beautiful view on the Uspenskiy Cathedral.

A two-storey semi-stone house under an iron roof was built in the late 18th century. as an outbuilding at the gubernia house. In 1805, on September 15, the first state pharmacy was opened in the Vladimir region on the first floor. Before that time, there was only a private pharmacy in the city, opened as far back as 1781. Until 2011, on the first floor of the house, there was a pharmacy, known to the citizens as "old pharmacy".

The Drama Theater in Vladimir was founded in 1848 and is one of the oldest in the country. The repertoire of the theater includes performances based on the works of famous classical authors, as well as plays by contemporary playwrights and fairy tales for children.

An outstanding monument of white stone architecture of pre-Mongol Rus. Orthodox church of the Vladimir diocese; also the state museum. Historically, before the rise of Moscow, was the main (cathedral) temple of Vladimir-Suzdal Rus, the Vladimir and Moscow princes married in the great reign. A monument of Russian architecture of the 12th century, which served as a model for a number of later cathedrals, including the Uspensky Cathedral of Aristotle Fioravanti. One of the few churches in which the unique frescoes of Andrei Rublev are preserved.

In the former water tower, there is a very interesting exposition of the Old Vladimir Museum-Reserve. Visitors will see photos of old Vladimir streets, household items, interiors, print production of pre-revolutionary times - all this recreates a vivid picture of the life and customs of the old Vladimir. On the top of the tower, there\'s an observation platform, where one can see the panorama of the city with its new districts, ancient monuments, picturesque views.

Square of military glory in Vladimir. The memorial on the square was built on the site of the Yamskaya Kazan zekvi demolished in 1966. The main component of the architectural design of the memorial on Victory Square is the stele in honor of the military units formed in Vladimir in 1941-1942. Contains a list of 9 military units formed in Vladimir in 1941-42.

\"The eternal memory of the Suzdalians who died in the battles for the freedom and independence of our homeland\" is engraved on a memorial stone. Due to the specificity of Suzdal, Eternal Fire is not a necessary place to visit, but in the autumn and winter many tourists come to it just to warm up.

It\'s not actually a sightseen, but nevertheless it\'s a unique drink that is produced ONLY in Suzdal by historical recipes. Mead which is called in russian "Medovuha" is original Russian traditional drink based on natural honey, prepared by the method of natural fermentation. The composition of the product is absolutely natural and suitable even for those who carefully choose food and drinks for the safety of ingredients.

Pokrovsky Monastery is an active women\'s monastery, and received its gloomy fame as a place of exile and imprisonment for aristocratic prisoners such as Vasiliy III\'s wife Solomoniya Saburova, wife of Ivan the Terrible\'s son Yevdokia, wife of Ivan the Terrible Anna Vasilchikova, wife of Peter I Evdokia Lopukhina.

The monument to Dmitry Mikhailovich Pozharsky, the national Russian hero, leader of the people\'s militia, which freed the country from Polish-Lithuanian invaders, stands against the backdrop of the entrance tower of the Spaso-Efimyev Monastery near the southern wall, in the square. The monument to the national hero was solemnly opened October 28, 1955.

In 1207, at the crossroads, Bishop Ioann of Rostov-Suzdal founded the convent of Reese of the Theotokos or Rizopolozhensky. The history of this monastery is closely connected with the famous Suzdal saint, whose relics many people still go to worship - the Monk Euphrosyne of Suzdal.

this landmark of Suzdal could well be put on the first place in the conditional ranking. In front of the main entrance, located in the monastery tower, is a small square with a monument to the most famous Suzdal citizen - Prince Dmitry Pozharsky. Spaso-Efimiev monastery was originally conceived as a fortress, the Suzdal principality after its unification with Nizhny Novgorod and the transfer of the squad to Nizhny needed a strong outpost to protect the western borders.

In the 12th century, the city began to be built on the site where the museum under the name "Suzdal Kremlin" is located nowadays. Here, in the bend of Kamenka river, the first earthworks were erected and the first city cathedral was built. The Kremlin preserved the ramparts, moats and some churches that historically belonged to the Kremlin. Now Suzdal Kremlin is a museum with numerous expositions dedicated to the history of Suzdal land, famous people associated with it, treasures from monasteries and churches, ancient Russian painting and applied art.

The shopping area is the central square of Suzdal. It originated in the middle of the 12th century and has since retained its layout, which in modern urban planning can be called a unique fact. Here, in the center of public life, all the large-scale holidays and events of the city are held. It is a popular tourist destination due to the large number of churches located here, and of course the guest house. Initially, all the churches were wooden, but in the 18th century after the fire they were replaced by stone ones, and in the 19th century the restoration of the courtyard building was carried out, where more than a hundred shopping malls were once located.

The Museum of Wooden Architecture and Peasant Life is a complex of architectural monuments in the open air. The exposition of the museum reproduces a small village with cottages, churches, household buildings and windmills of the XVII-XIX centuries, which were brought here from different parts of the Vladimir region. Over the reconstructed village towering two churches, erected without a single nail. Here you can see the house of a simple farm laborer, a well-to-do peasant and a merchant. In the interiors the huts store samovars and furniture, dishes and toys, wooden spinning wheels and looms.
Pedestal with a memorial plate in memory of the participants in the liquidation of the Chernobyl nuclear power plant accident was installed In April 2001 near the house number 2 in the first block.
This is a monument to veterans of Afghanistan and Chechnya war conflicts. It was installed in 2015.

It\'s not an official sightseen. Actually it\'s a private monument of local oil company. It can be figured out by cautious inspection of the image - the dragon is nestling an oil tower. Raduzhnyy citizens call this monument a "Skyrim dragon" in parallel with respective computer game.

Main city fountain, which works every evening during snowless period of the year. It has musical and lumiere accompanying. This in one of the favourite places for citizens to spend their evening time.

The name of the founder of Raduzhnyy is known to every inhabitant of the city. It is General Ivan Sergeevich Kosminov. In 1971, when the construction of the Raduga design bureau was started, Kosminov was commissioned to supervise the work. Simultaneously, the construction of necessary housing facilities and infrastructure was carried out. So it was first formed the village of Vladimir-30, and then the city of Raduzhnyy.
This monument was installed at July 30, 2004 in the honor of seamen, who died defending the glory of russian fleet.

This is an unfinished building of a modern living house. Hardly anybody now will tell why it is called \"Pentagon\". It\'s not an official sightseen, and its area is restricted to enter. But this object is not guarded by anyone, and Raduzhnyy citizens, especially younger ones very love this building, because if one climbs on the roof, then a very beautiful view on town and long distances is opened.
This high stone stele was erected in memory of those were killed during the World War 2. Established in honor of the 70th anniversary of victory.

one of the oldest monasteries in the north-east of Russia. Belongs to the Vladimir-Suzdal Diocese of the Russian Orthodox Church. This monastery is one of the main attractions of Murom, which guests visit. Presumably the relics of Elijah the Murom of the saint are in the Chievo-Pechora Lavra. Bogatyr was canonized among her other companions in 1643. Information about his life is drawn from folk legends - in the annals we do not meet his name, but in the Western European sagas of the XII-XIII centuries a certain Ilya from Russia is mentioned.

During the Great Patriotic War, Murom was a rear city. Its inhabitants selflessly worked in factories, raised funds for the defense of the country. So, as a gift to the front, workers of the locomotive repair shops built an armored train in 1941-1942. The authorities wanted to call him "For the Motherland", but the builders at the rally defended their name - "Ilya Muromets". It is symbolic that during the war the Murom iron hero destroyed in battle the enemy armored train "Adolf Hitler".

Picturesque micro district Karacharovo (once the village-home of Ilya of Murom) - in itself is already a tourist attraction. According to written sources, the village of Karacharovo is known since the XVII century. From the monuments of architecture here is the estate "Krasnaya Gora" including a manor house, two outbuildings, outbuildings and a linden alley. The village has preserved the sights associated with the name of the most famous of its native - the hero Ilya of Murom.

On the observation deck in 1999, a monument to the hero Ilya Muromets was erected. Sculptor Vyacheslav Klykov (his most famous work is a monument to Marshal G.K. Zhukov in Moscow) depicted him in two hypostases - as a warrior and as a monk: in a raised hand the saint holds a sword, and in another - a cross. The militant gesture of Ilya Muromets is not accidental - here, on the banks of the Oka River, the border of the Russian lands passed in antiquity. At the pedestal of the monument are the figures of seated griffins. With his left paw, fabulous birds rest on a shield.

Cable-stayed bridge across the Oka River near the city of Murom in the Vladimir region and the city of Navashino in the Nizhny Novgorod region. Recently it was recognized as the most beautiful bridge in Russia, and according to the deputy head of the Federal Road Agency is a world-class landmark that the whole country can be proud of rightfully.

The railway station building was, remains and, for certain, will remain the pride of the Murom, one of the business cards and attractions of the city. To the 100th anniversary of the opening, a small museum was opened inside the building, where exhibits from different eras tell of the history of the Murom railway station.

One of the most beautiful temples in Murom, located at the intersection of two important city highways of the streets of Moscow and Leo Tolstoy. It was built in 1729 instead of the wooden Ascension church.

Monument to the people who fell in battle for their homeland in 1941-1945. was installed in the town of Murom in the town of Murom in 1975. The history of the monument is interesting. According to the project manager G.N. Karachev in the famous film "Optimistic tragedy" he saw a monument to the sailors of the Civil War. Out of a single block of stone, the figures of the dead seamen were appearing. The concept of sculpture shocked G.N. Karachev and he had an idea about creating a similar monument in the village of Verbovsk, but dedicated to the perished of the Verbovians during the Great Patriotic War.

Vladimir Zvorykin is the most famous Muromlian (after Ilya Muromets), the founder of modern television. He was born in Murom in the family of the merchant of the first guild of Kozma Zvorykin. The idea of composition of the monument: a student of the St. Petersburg "polytechnic" of the early 20th century, Vladimir Zvorykin, sitting on a bench near his home.
